title: Part B
stimulusHtml:
1 point is earned for indicating f decreases then increases

1 point is earned for eliminating x=5 for maximum

1 point is earned for absolute minimum at x=4

1 point is earned for absolute maximum at x=-1

The function f decreases from x=-1 to x=4, then increases from x=4 to x=5.

Therefore, the absolute minimum value for f is at x=4. The absolute maximum value must occur at x=-1 or at x=5.

f(5)−f(−1)= ∫ −1 5 f (t) d _ t<0

Since f(5)<f(-1), the absolute maximum value occurs at x=-1.

1 point is earned for indicating f decreases then increases

1 point is earned for absolute minimum at x=4

1 point is earned for absolute maximum at x=-1

The function f decreases from x=-1 to x=4, then increases from x=4 to x=5.

Since f(5)<f(-1), the absolute maximum value occurs at x=-1.
